website_summaries.verdict: The NuForce HP-800 is a no-frills studio monitor headphone pair that offers a crisp, articulate response, but is less reliable on tracks with deep bass.
pros: Crisp, bright frequency response ideal for genres without deep bass
Innovative headband design is secure and easy to wear for long periods
cons: Distorts on deep bass at higher volumes
Doesn't have offer much bass response at moderate volumes
No phone controls on either cable

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, middling build, no support
customer_reviews.text: Not bad headphones for the money, but they broke at the hinge between the earcup and the headband in less than a year for me (I'm not hard on my headphones), and they have no support or warranty contact in the US.
customer_reviews.author: Vinit Agarwal

customer_reviews.title: Finally...Headphones that fit my huge head
customer_reviews.text: Did quite a bit of research before landing on these. Their solid construction, metal speaker housings, and ideal flat response for mixing and finishing music led me to choose them. Comfort is a plus, as having a large head makes wearing most headphones difficult, and these adjust to fit on regular size heads comfortably as well. Much quality for a modest price.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Aberdonian

customer_reviews.title: Quality headphones
customer_reviews.text: These did not disappoint. Comfortable and good sound while I am recording audiobooks.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Little

customer_reviews.title: Still good quality for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Lasted nearly 2 years. The ear broke loose and it was all over. Still good quality for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Pasta

customer_reviews.title: compatible with V-modda Boom pro
customer_reviews.text: i use these for gaming. paired with the V- Modda Boom Pro, so far so good. they are comfy but get my ears warm. meet my expectations. got my bang for my buck also the mic plugs direct to the headset no other wires needed
customer_reviews.author: jesseb

customer_reviews.title: cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: 2.5 months and they broke...the hinge between the ear cups and the headband is fragile--easily busted...these are definitely NOT worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Mom with Two BOYS

customer_reviews.title: A real discovery
customer_reviews.text: Great cans, real bang for your buck, powerful bass without veil or recessed mid-range, you could call them "a Soundmagic HP100 with steroids", lots of detail with an "oomph" and more than comfortable for hours of listening; sound good too without it, but they would benefit from a amp as their impedance is low (32 Ohm), but so their sensitivity (91 dB).
customer_reviews.author: Mantygre

customer_reviews.title: They were very comfortable, a little heave and a little bass-y but ...
customer_reviews.text: After about a year the mechanical joint on the earpiece broke. They were very comfortable, a little heave and a little bass-y but otherwise good. Too bad they weren't very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Totally happy with the item
customer_reviews.text: Totally happy with the item, great quality of the item and fast shipment. I love NuForce headphones always, and this piece again is definitely worth for its price with its excellent sound reproduction!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for great price
customer_reviews.text: Yet another excellent audio product from NuForce. Unbeatable for the price and can easily compete with studio headphones in 300$ range. Material and build seems a little cheaper, but on audio side they're flawless. Not much else left to say...
customer_reviews.author: Ladislav Jochman

customer_reviews.title: Sound Great, Build Quality Less So
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great, unfortunately build quality is a bit lacking. One of the joints broke after a couple months of regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Horribly Built
customer_reviews.text: This pair of headphones is such garbage in terms of construction. The plastic clip that holds the headband to the earcups has broken for me 3 times rendering the headphones useless. The support and RMA speed is also pretty atrocious. Don't waste your time with these headphones, they aren't anything special
customer_reviews.author: LongBongMilver

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, a little bass heavy
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all. These are pretty good headphone, and very much so for the price (they were on sale for ~$80, when I bought them). However, they are very bass rich, a little too much for my taste. My reference headphones are Sennheiser HD600 (admittedly much more expensive) and in comparison, the NuForce HP-800 doesn't fare too well. Otherwise, I'm a big NuForce fan!
customer_reviews.author: Surfer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: 3 Months into the product, the right here phone went and isn't working. I've had cheaper stuff last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: NuForce HP-800 Black Monitor-Quality Classic Style Headphones
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Frustration-Free PackagingThe NuForce HP-800 is a studio-monitor class headphone for the music professional or audio enthusiast who demands accuracy and musicality along with unprecedented value. The HP-800 delivers the kind of performance sound professionals require to do their work, yet, their precision notwithstanding, the 'phones are nether harsh nor fatiguing. Indeed, the HP-800 renders recordings with the kind of natural warmth, realistic highs and visceral bass only true accuracy is capable of attaining.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars28 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
